meanings.definition: Having a sturdy and robust build.
meanings.sent1: The bulldog was stockier than the poodle.
meanings.sent2: The oak tree was stockier than the willow tree.
meanings.sent3: The stockier teddy bear won the wrestling match against the slimmer one.
meanings.sent4: His stockier frame made him stand out in the crowd like a boulder among pebbles.
meanings.sent5: The stockier man's presence filled the room with a sense of strength and solidity.

meanings.definition: More solid or substantial in form.
meanings.sent1: The old bookshelf was stockier after it was reinforced.
meanings.sent2: The stockier bridge could withstand the weight of heavy trucks.
meanings.sent3: The stockier cake held up better under the weight of the frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her stockier arguments were harder to shake compared to his flimsy excuses.
meanings.sent5: The stockier building stood tall against the strong winds, unyielding and solid.

meanings.sent1: The stockier rope was more difficult to tie knots in.
meanings.sent2: The stockier trunk of the tree provided more shade.
meanings.sent3: The stockier belt was too big for his waist, making his pants fall down comically.
meanings.sent4: The stockier clouds in the sky signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The stockier layer of frosting on the cake made it look more indulgent and tempting.
